page.title: 18MUSLIM COMMUNITY:Sheffield
page.content: There is a large Muslim community in east Sheffield, mainly from{Pakistan, and including second and third generation families. There are several local mosques, all well attended. Many of the children have classes every evening to learn the{Koran}in Arabic. The home is the main place to learn about the Muslim religion (Islam) and also to speak Punjabi or Urdu, not widely taught in local schools yet. There are{Halal butchers,}who sell meat killed in the Islamic manner, and grocers selling a wide variety of spices, unusual vegetables, pulses and tinned goods. Many of the restaurants and take-away hot food shops are Pakistani, popular with a wide range of people from inside and outside the area.
